functions.name: getFrame
functions.description: Retrieves information about the given frame. A frame refers to an <iframe> or a <frame> of a web page and is identified by a tab ID and a frame ID.

parameters.name: details
parameters.description: Information about the frame to retrieve information about.

tabId.description: The ID of the tab in which the frame is.

frameId.description: The ID of the frame in the given tab.

parameters.name: details
parameters.description: Information about the requested frame, null if the specified frame ID and/or tab ID are invalid.

errorOccurred.description: True if the last navigation in this frame was interrupted by an error, i.e. the onErrorOccurred event fired.

url.description: The URL currently associated with this frame, if the frame identified by the frameId existed at one point in the given tab. The fact that an URL is associated with a given frameId does not imply that the corresponding frame still exists.

functions.name: getAllFrames
functions.description: Retrieves information about all frames of a given tab.

parameters.name: details
parameters.description: Information about the tab to retrieve all frames from.

tabId.description: The ID of the tab.

parameters.description: A list of frames in the given tab, null if the specified tab ID is invalid.

errorOccurred.description: True if the last navigation in this frame was interrupted by an error, i.e. the onErrorOccurred event fired.

frameId.description: The ID of the frame. 0 indicates that this is the main frame; a positive value indicates the ID of a subframe.

url.description: The URL currently associated with this frame, if the frame identified by the frameId existed at one point in the given tab. The fact that an URL is associated with a given frameId does not imply that the corresponding frame still exists.

events.name: onBeforeNavigate
events.description: Fired when a navigation is about to occur.

tabId.description: The ID of the tab in which the navigation is about to occur.

frameId.description: 0 indicates the navigation happens in the tab content window; a positive value indicates navigation in a subframe. Frame IDs are unique within a tab.

timeStamp.description: The time when the browser was about to start the navigation, in milliseconds since the epoch.

events.name: onCommitted
events.description: Fired when a navigation is committed. The document (and the resources it refers to, such as images and subframes) might still be downloading, but at least part of the document has been received from the server and the browser has decided to switch to the new document.

tabId.description: The ID of the tab in which the navigation occurs.

frameId.description: 0 indicates the navigation happens in the tab content window; a positive value indicates navigation in a subframe. Frame IDs are unique within a tab.

transitionType.description: Cause of the navigation. The same transition types as defined in the history API are used.

timeStamp.description: The time when the navigation was committed, in milliseconds since the epoch.

events.name: onDOMContentLoaded
events.description: Fired when the page's DOM is fully constructed, but the referenced resources may not finish loading.

tabId.description: The ID of the tab in which the navigation occurs.

frameId.description: 0 indicates the navigation happens in the tab content window; a positive value indicates navigation in a subframe. Frame IDs are unique within a tab.

timeStamp.description: The time when the page's DOM was fully constructed, in milliseconds since the epoch.

events.name: onCompleted
events.description: Fired when a document, including the resources it refers to, is completely loaded and initialized.

tabId.description: The ID of the tab in which the navigation occurs.

frameId.description: 0 indicates the navigation happens in the tab content window; a positive value indicates navigation in a subframe. Frame IDs are unique within a tab.

timeStamp.description: The time when the document finished loading, in milliseconds since the epoch.

events.name: onErrorOccurred
events.description: Fired when an error occurs and the navigation is aborted. This can happen if either a network error occurred, or the user aborted the navigation.

tabId.description: The ID of the tab in which the navigation occurs.

frameId.description: 0 indicates the navigation happens in the tab content window; a positive value indicates navigation in a subframe. Frame IDs are unique within a tab.

timeStamp.description: The time when the error occurred, in milliseconds since the epoch.

events.name: onCreatedNavigationTarget
events.description: Fired when a new window, or a new tab in an existing window, is created to host a navigation.

sourceTabId.description: The ID of the tab in which the navigation is triggered.

sourceFrameId.description: The ID of the frame with sourceTabId in which the navigation is triggered. 0 indicates the main frame.

url.description: The URL to be opened in the new window.

tabId.description: The ID of the tab in which the url is opened

timeStamp.description: The time when the browser was about to create a new view, in milliseconds since the epoch.

events.name: onReferenceFragmentUpdated
events.description: Fired when the reference fragment of a frame was updated. All future events for that frame will use the updated URL.

tabId.description: The ID of the tab in which the navigation occurs.

frameId.description: 0 indicates the navigation happens in the tab content window; a positive value indicates navigation in a subframe. Frame IDs are unique within a tab.

transitionType.description: Cause of the navigation. The same transition types as defined in the history API are used.

timeStamp.description: The time when the navigation was committed, in milliseconds since the epoch.

types.description: An object describing filters to apply to webRequest events.

urls.description: A list of URLs or URL patterns. Requests that cannot match any of the URLs will be filtered out.

types.description: A list of request types. Requests that cannot match any of the types will be filtered out.
An array of HTTP headers. Each header is represented as a dictionary containing the keys name and either value or binaryValue.

value.description: Value of the HTTP header if it can be represented by UTF-8.

binaryValue.description: Value of the HTTP header if it cannot be represented by UTF-8, stored as individual byte values (0..255).

types.description: Returns value for event handlers that have the 'blocking' extraInfoSpec applied. Allows the event handler to modify network requests.

cancel.description: If true, the request is cancelled. Used in onBeforeRequest, this prevents the request from being sent.

redirectUrl.description: Only used as a response to the onBeforeRequest event. If set, the original request is prevented from being sent and is instead redirected to the given URL.

requestHeaders.description: Only used as a response to the onBeforeSendHeaders event. If set, the request is made with these request headers instead.

responseHeaders.description: Only used as a response to the onHeadersReceived event. If set, the server is assumed to have responsed with these response headers instead. Only return responseHeaders if you really want to modify the headers in order to limit the number of conflicts (only one extension may modify responseHeaders for each request).

authCredentials.description: Only used as a response to the onAuthRequired event. If set, the request is made using the supplied credentials.

functions.name: addEventListener
functions.description: Used internally to implement the special form of addListener for the webRequest events.

parameters.name: filter
parameters.description: A set of filters that restricts the events that will be sent to this listener.

parameters.name: extraInfoSpec
parameters.description: Array of extra information that should be passed to the listener function.

functions.name: eventHandled
functions.description: Used internally to send a response for a blocked event.

functions.name: handlerBehaviorChanged
functions.description: Needs to be called when the behavior of the webRequest handlers has changed to prevent incorrect handling due to caching. This function call is expensive. Don't call it often.

events.name: onBeforeRequest
events.description: Fired when a request is about to occur.

requestId.description: The ID of the request. Request IDs are unique within a browser session. As a result, they could be used to relate different events of the same request.

frameId.description: 0 indicates the request happens in the main frame; a positive value indicates the ID of a subframe in which the request happens. If the document of a (sub-)frame is loaded (type is main_frame or sub_frame), frameId indicates the ID of this frame, not the ID of the outer frame. Frame IDs are unique within a tab.

parentFrameId.description: ID of frame that wraps the frame which sent the request. Set to -1 if no parent frame exists.

tabId.description: The ID of the tab in which the request takes place. Set to -1 if the request isn't related to a tab.

type.description: How the requested resource will be used.

timeStamp.description: The time when this signal is triggered, in milliseconds since the epoch.

extraParameters.name: filter
extraParameters.description: A set of filters that restricts the events that will be sent to this listener.

extraParameters.name: extraInfoSpec
extraParameters.description: Array of extra information that should be passed to the listener function.

returns.description: If "blocking" is specified in the "extraInfoSpec" parameter, the event listener should return an object of this type.

events.name: onBeforeSendHeaders
events.description: Fired before sending an HTTP request, once the request headers are available. This may occur after a TCP connection is made to the server, but before any HTTP data is sent.

requestId.description: The ID of the request. Request IDs are unique within a browser session. As a result, they could be used to relate different events of the same request.

If the document of a (sub-)frame is loaded (type is main_frame or sub_frame), frameId indicates the ID of this frame, not the ID of the outer frame. Frame IDs are unique within a tab.

functions.name: getConfig
functions.description: Gives configuration options set by the test.

testServer.description: Details on the test server used to mock network responses.  Will be set only if test calls ExtensionApiTest::StartTestServer().

port.description: The port on which the test server is listening.

testDataDirectory.description: file:/// URL for the API test data directory.

functions.name: notifyFail
functions.description: Notifies the browser process that test code running in the extension failed.  This is only used for internal unit testing.

functions.name: notifyPass
functions.description: Notifies the browser process that test code running in the extension passed.  This is only used for internal unit testing.

functions.name: resetQuota
functions.description: Resets all accumulated quota state for all extensions.  This is only used for internal unit testing.

functions.name: log
functions.description: Logs a message during internal unit testing.

functions.name: createIncognitoTab
functions.description: Creates an incognito tab during internal testing. Succeeds even if the extension is not enabled in incognito mode.

functions.name: sendMessage
functions.description: Sends a string message to the browser process, generating a Notification that C++ test code can wait for.

events.name: onMessage
events.description: Used to test sending messages to extensions.

lastMessage.description: True if this was the last message for this test

types.description: An object encapsulating a single proxy server's specification.

scheme.description: The scheme (protocol) of the proxy server itself. Defaults to 'http'.

host.description: The URI of the proxy server. This must be an ASCII hostname (in Punycode format). IDNA is not supported, yet.

port.description: The port of the proxy server. Defaults to a port that depends on the scheme.

types.description: An object encapsulating the set of proxy rules for all protocols. Use either 'singleProxy' or (a subset of) 'proxyForHttp', 'proxyForHttps', 'proxyForFtp' and 'fallbackProxy'.

singleProxy.description: The proxy server to be used for all per-URL requests (that is http, https, and ftp).

proxyForHttp.description: The proxy server to be used for HTTP requests.

proxyForHttps.description: The proxy server to be used for HTTPS requests.

proxyForFtp.description: The proxy server to be used for FTP requests.

fallbackProxy.description: The proxy server to be used for everthing else or if any of the specific proxyFor... is not specified.

bypassList.description: List of servers to connect to without a proxy server.

types.description: An object holding proxy auto-config information. Exactly one of the fields should be non-empty.

url.description: URL of the PAC file to be used.

mandatory.description: If true, an invalid PAC script will prevent the network stack from falling back to direct connections. Defaults to false.

types.description: An object encapsulating a complete proxy configuration.

rules.description: The proxy rules describing this configuration. Use this for 'fixed_servers' mode.

pacScript.description: The proxy auto-config (PAC) script for this configuration. Use this for 'pac_script' mode.

mode.description:
'direct' = Never use a proxy
'auto_detect' = Auto detect proxy settings
'pac_script' = Use specified PAC script
'fixed_servers' = Manually specify proxy servers
'system' = Use system proxy settings

settings.description: Proxy settings to be used. The value of this setting is a ProxyConfig object.

events.name: onProxyError
events.description: Notifies about proxy errors.

fatal.description: If true, the error was fatal and the network transaction was aborted. Otherwise, a direct connection is used instead.

details.description: Additional details about the error such as a JavaScript runtime error.

functions.name: hide
functions.description: Hides sidebar's mini tab for the specified tab and collapses sidebar if it was in 'active' state (see getState). Has no effect if the sidebar is already hidden.

tabId.description: Defaults to the selected tab of the current window.

functions.name: show
functions.description: Shows sidebar mini tab (in 'shown' state) for the specified tab. Has no effect if already expanded, otherwise changes status to 'shown'.

tabId.description: Defaults to the selected tab of the current window.

functions.name: expand
functions.description: Expands sidebar and switches to the specified content (if it was displaying another extension's sidebar content) for the specified tab. Extension is allowed to expand sidebar only in response to an explicit user gesture.

tabId.description: Defaults to the selected tab of the current window.

functions.name: collapse
functions.description: Collapses sidebar for the specified tab. Has no effect if sidebar is not in its 'active' state (see getState).

tabId.description: Defaults to the selected tab of the current window.

functions.name: navigate
functions.description: Loads the the specified html file into the sidebar for the specified tab.

tabId.description: Defaults to the selected tab of the current window.

path.description: Relative path to the html file in the extension to show in the sidebar.

functions.name: getState
functions.description: Returns current sidebar state for the specified tab.

tabId.description: Defaults to the selected tab of the current window.

parameters.name: state
parameters.description:
'hidden' indicates sidebar is not defined for the specified tab (show was never called or hide() was called). Nothing is displayed for this sidebar.
'shown' means sidebar is defined for the specified tab; mini tab is displayed for this sidebar. Sidebar UI is either collapsed or displaying a content of some other extension's sidebar.
'active' indicates that sidebar is defined for the specified tab; sidebar UI is expanded and displaying this sidebar's content.

functions.name: setBadgeText
functions.description: Sets sidebar's mini tab badge text for the specified tab.

tabId.description: Defaults to the selected tab of the current window.

text.description: The sidebar's badge text. The badge is displayed on top of the sidebar's icon on the mini tab. Any number of characters can be passed, but only about four can fit in the space.

functions.name: setIcon
functions.description: Sets sidebar's mini tab icon for the specified tab.

tabId.description: Defaults to the selected tab of the current window.

imageData.description: Pixel data for an image to show on the sidebar's mini tab. Must be an ImageData object (for example, from a canvas element). Only one of the imagePath/imageData parameters all owed. The extension's icon is used by default. The preferred size of the icon is 16x16 pixels, any other size will be scaled to 16x16.

path.description: Relative path to an image in the extension to show on the sidebar's mini tab. Only one of the imagePath/imageData parameters all owed. The extension's icon is used by default. The preferred size of the icon is 16x16 pixels, any other size will be scaled to 16x16.

functions.name: setTitle
functions.description: Sets sidebar's mini tab title for the specified tab.

tabId.description: Defaults to the selected tab of the current window.

title.description: The sidebar's title. It is displayed in a tooltip over the sidebar's mini tab.

events.name: onStateChanged
events.description: Notifies about sidebar state changes.

types.description: A suggest result.

content.description: The text that is put into the URL bar, and that is sent to the extension when the user chooses this entry.

description.description: The text that is displayed in the URL dropdown. Can contain XML-style markup for styling. The supported tags are 'url' (for a literal URL), 'match' (for highlighting text that matched what the user's query), and 'dim' (for dim helper text). The styles can be nested, eg. <dim><match>dimmed match</match></dim>.

functions.name: sendSuggestions
functions.description: A callback passed to the onInputChanged event used for sending suggestions back to the browser.

parameters.description: Array of suggest results

functions.name: setDefaultSuggestion
functions.description: Sets the description and styling for the default suggestion. The default suggestion is the text that is displayed in the first suggestion row underneath the URL bar.

parameters.name: suggestion
parameters.description: A partial SuggestResult object, without the 'content' parameter. See SuggestResult for a description of the parameters.

description.description: The text to display in the default suggestion. The placeholder string '%s' can be included and will be replaced with the user's input.

events.name: onInputStarted
events.description: User has started a keyword input session by typing the extension's keyword. This is guaranteed to be sent exactly once per input session, and before any onInputChanged events.

events.name: onInputChanged
events.description: User has changed what is typed into the omnibox.

parameters.name: suggest
parameters.description: A callback passed to the onInputChanged event used for sending suggestions back to the browser.
Array of suggest results

events.name: onInputEntered
events.description: User has accepted what is typed into the omnibox.

events.name: onInputCancelled
events.description: User has ended the keyword input session without accepting the input.

types.description: Information about an icon belonging to an extension or app.

size.description: A number representing the width and height of the icon. Likely values include (but are not limited to) 128, 48, 24, and 16.

url.description: The URL for this icon image. To display a grayscale version of the icon (to indicate that an extension is disabled, for example), append ?grayscale=true to the URL.

types.description: Information about an installed extension or app.

name.description: The name of this extension or app.

description.description: The description of this extension or app.

version.description: The version of this extension or app.

mayDisable.description: Whether this extension can be disabled or uninstalled by the user.

enabled.description: Whether it is currently enabled or disabled.

disabledReason.description: A reason the item is disabled.

isApp.description: True if this is an app.

appLaunchUrl.description: The launch url (only present for apps).

homepageUrl.description: The URL of the homepage of this extension or app.

updateUrl.description: The update URL of this extension or app.

offlineEnabled.description: Whether the extension or app declares that it supports offline.

optionsUrl.description: The url for the item's options page, if it has one.

icons.description: A list of icon information. Note that this just reflects what was declared in the manifest, and the actual image at that url may be larger or smaller than what was declared, so you might consider using explicit width and height attributes on img tags referencing these images. See the manifest documentation on icons for more details.

hostPermissions.description: Returns a list of host based permissions.

types.description: An interface which allows access to a Chrome browser setting.

functions.name: get
functions.description: Gets the value of a setting.

parameters.name: details
parameters.description: What setting to consider.

incognito.description: Whether to return the setting that applies to the incognito session (default false).

parameters.name: details
parameters.description: Details of the currently effective value.

levelOfControl.description:
One of
not_controllable: cannot be controlled by any extension
controlled_by_other_extensions: controlled by extensions with higher precedence
controllable_by_this_extension: can be controlled by this extension
controlled_by_this_extension: controlled by this extension

incognitoSpecific.description:
Whether the effective value is specific to the incognito session.
This property will only be present if the incognito property in the details parameter of get() was true.

functions.name: set
functions.description: Sets the value of a setting.

parameters.name: details
parameters.description: What setting to change.

value.description:
The value of the setting.
Note that every setting has a specific value type, which is described together with the setting. An extension should not set a value of a different type.

scope.description:
Where to set the setting (default: regular). One of
regular: setting for regular profile (which is inherited by the incognito profile if not overridden elsewhere),
incognito_persistent: setting for incognito profile that survives browser restarts (overrides regular preferences),
incognito_session_only: setting for incognito profile that can only be set during an incognito session and is deleted when the incognito session ends (overrides regular and incognito_persistent preferences).

parameters.name: callback
parameters.description: Called after the setting has been set.

functions.name: clear
functions.description: Clears the setting. This way default settings can become effective again.

parameters.name: details
parameters.description: What setting to clear.

scope.description:
Where to clear the setting (default: regular). One of
regular: setting for regular profile (which is inherited by the incognito profile if not overridden elsewhere),
incognito_persistent: setting for incognito profile that survives browser restarts (overrides regular preferences),
incognito_session_only: setting for incognito profile that can only be set during an incognito session and is deleted when the incognito session ends (overrides regular and incognito_persistent preferences).

parameters.name: callback
parameters.description: Called after the setting has been cleared.

events.name: onChange
events.description: Fired when the value of the setting changes.

levelOfControl.description:
One of
not_controllable: cannot be controlled by any extension
controlled_by_other_extensions: controlled by extensions with higher precedence
controllable_by_this_extension: can be controlled by this extension
controlled_by_this_extension: controlled by this extension

incognitoSpecific.description:
Whether the value that has changed is specific to the incognito session.
This property will only be present if the user has enabled the extension in incognito mode.

id.description: The resource identifier for the given content type.

description.description: A human readable description of the resource.

types.description: The only content type using resource identifiers is plugins. For more information, see Resource Identifiers.

functions.name: clear
functions.description: Clear all content setting rules set by this extension.

scope.description:
Where to set the setting (default: regular). One of
regular: setting for regular profile (which is inherited by the incognito profile if not overridden elsewhere),
incognito_session_only: setting for incognito profile that can only be set during an incognito session and is deleted when the incognito session ends (overrides regular settings).

functions.name: get
functions.description: Gets the current content setting for a given pair of URLs.

primaryUrl.description: The primary URL for which the content setting should be retrieved. Note that the meaning of a primary URL depends on the content type.

secondaryUrl.description: The secondary URL for which the content setting should be retrieved. Defaults to the primary URL. Note that the meaning of a secondary URL depends on the content type, and not all content types use secondary URLs.

resourceIdentifier.description: A more specific identifier of the type of content for which the settings should be retrieved.

incognito.description: Whether to check the content settings for an incognito session. (default false)

setting.description: The content setting. See the description of the individual ContentSetting objects for the possible values.

functions.name: set
functions.description: Applies a new content setting rule.

primaryPattern.description: The pattern for the primary URL. For details on the format of a pattern, see Content Setting Patterns.

secondaryPattern.description: The pattern for the secondary URL. Defaults to matching all URLs. For details on the format of a pattern, see Content Setting Patterns.

resourceIdentifier.description: The resource identifier for the content type.

setting.description: The setting applied by this rule. See the description of the individual ContentSetting objects for the possible values.

scope.description:
Where to clear the setting (default: regular). One of
regular: setting for regular profile (which is inherited by the incognito profile if not overridden elsewhere),
incognito_session_only: setting for incognito profile that can only be set during an incognito session and is deleted when the incognito session ends (overrides regular settings).

parameters.description: A list of resource identifiers for this content type, or <var>undefined</var> if this content type does not use resource identifiers.

cookies.description:
Whether to allow cookies and other local data to be set by websites. One of
allow: Accept cookies,
block: Block cookies,
session_only: Accept cookies only for the current session.
Default is allow.
The primary URL is the URL representing the cookie origin. The secondary URL is the URL of the top-level frame.

images.description:
Whether to show images. One of
allow: Show images,
block: Don't show images.
Default is allow.
The primary URL is the main-frame URL. The secondary URL is the URL of the image.

javascript.description:
Whether to run JavaScript. One of
allow: Run JavaScript,
block: Don't run JavaScript.
Default is allow.
The primary URL is the main-frame URL. The secondary URL is not used.

plugins.description:
Whether to run plug-ins. One of
allow: Run plug-ins automatically,
block: Don't run plug-ins automatically.
Default is allow.
The primary URL is the main-frame URL. The secondary URL is not used.

popups.description:
Whether to allow sites to show pop-ups. One of
allow: Allow sites to show pop-ups,
block: Don't allow sites to show pop-ups.
Default is block.
The primary URL is the main-frame URL. The secondary URL is not used.

notifications.description:
Whether to allow sites to show desktop notifications. One of
allow: Allow sites to show desktop notifications,
block: Don't allow sites to show desktop notifications,
ask: Ask when a site wants to show desktop notifications.
Default is ask.
The primary URL is the main-frame URL. The secondary URL is not used.

network.description: Settings that influence Chrome's handling of network connections in general.

networkPredictionEnabled.description: If enabled, Chrome attempts to speed up your web browsing experience by pre-resolving DNS entries, prerendering sites (<link rel='prefetch' ...>), and preemptively opening TCP and SSL connections to servers. This preference's value is a boolean, defaulting to true.

services.description: Settings that enable or disable features that require third-party network services provided by Google and your default search provider.

alternateErrorPagesEnabled.description: If enabled, Chrome uses a web service to help resolve navigation errors. This preference's value is a boolean, defaulting to true.

autofillEnabled.description: If enabled, Chrome offers to automatically fill in forms. This preference's value is a boolean, defaulting to true.

instantEnabled.description: If enabled, Chrome automatically performs and displays search requests for text you type into the Omnibox as you type it. This preference's value is a boolean, defaulting to true.

metricsReportingEnabled.description: If enabled, Chrome automatically sends usage statistics and crash reports to Google. This preference's value is a boolean, defaulting to false.

safeBrowsingEnabled.description: If enabled, Chrome does its best to protect you from phishing and malware. This preference's value is a boolean, defaulting to true.

searchSuggestEnabled.description: If enabled, Chrome sends the text you type into the Omnibox to your default search engine, which provides predictions of websites and searches that are likely completions of what you've typed so far. This preference's value is a boolean, defaulting to true.

translationServiceEnabled.description: If enabled, Chrome offers to translate pages that aren't in a language you read. This preference's value is a boolean, defaulting to true.

websites.description: Settings that determine what information Chrome sends when requesting websites.

thirdPartyCookiesAllowed.description: If disabled, Chrome blocks third-party sites from setting cookies. The value of this preference is of type boolean, and the default value is true.

hyperlinkAuditingEnabled.description: If enabled, Chrome sends auditing pings when requested by a website (<a ping>). The value of this preference is of type boolean, and the default value is true.

referrersEnabled.description: If enabled, Chrome sends referer headers with your requests. Yes, the name of this preference doesn't match the misspelled header. No, we're not going to change it. The value of this preference is of type boolean, and the default value is true.
